review_title: Enriching experience that hones transferable skills

cons: Tutors' two-hour shifts must start on even hours. Limited availability on Fridays and Saturdays.

review_title: Great environment, but lacks opportunities to advance career.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in London, ON
pros: The student/faculty/staff community, benefits are good, plenty of free events on campus that you can attend, food and coffee easily available on campus and just minutes from your desk, downtown Saratoga is also just minutes away, free gym access.
cons: Too much politics for all positions, HR not very helpful, lower tiered employees don't have a true voice, older leadership stuck in old ways, pay scale isn't great compared to other jobs outside of higher ed, the hierarchy within departments is very rigid.

review_title: Good Start and Benefits; Sometimes Unfavorable Social Culture
job_title: Dining Services Employee in London, ON
pros: Good benefits and fair pay. Oftentimes had enough/extra hours and opportunities for upward movement. Coworkers and yourself have an opportunity to get close. Learning on the job is expected and fostered; if you put in extra effort/show interest, you can learn skills outside of your job description's parameters. Can have opportunities to shift the specific areas you work. Can meet many new people of various ages. Can meet great people for future job references and friendship.
cons: Some sexism and issues with personal space/unsavory jokes when SOME folks get too comfortable/familiar with you. Also, a small handful of male coworkers made younger female staff uncomfortable when they found them attractive (myself and others who confided to me). Sometimes this was done unconsciously, and others times it was egregious and objectively rude/out of line.

review_title: Pretty good place- some interesting politics
job_title: in London, ON
pros: Awesome students and a fun work environment. The campus is lovely and there are events happening all the time. Many colleagues are friendly and fun. A great town for families.
cons: The college is having issues with the economic downturn. The resulting changes contradict the foundations of a liberal arts school. Larger classes, professors teaching more classes per semester. Some professors are paid by the class they teach... about 3,330$ per class. Conceivably there are professors working full time but only making 20,000$ per year. It's a shame. There are also weird politics in different departments.

job_title: Senior Marketing Associate / Marketing Manager in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros: I had a wonderful time working with Skidmore in various departments. I enjoyed the sense of community and team-oriented atmosphere. Despite different levels of employment, everyone in the team worked together and there was not really a sense of top-down management in a negative or hierarchical way.
cons: With many different departments, the silo effect can happen at Skidmore, but I think it's mitigated by strong advocates in all departments and cross-departmental collaboration.

review_title: Great College to work for, hard finding tenure track positions
job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros: Wonderful and welcoming coworkers (at least in my department), not a huge divide between faculty and administration (great President).  Students were generally a pleasure to work with.  For a small liberal arts college, a lot of research opportunities.  Great "town - gown" relationship.  Good opportunities for interdisciplinary and collaborative teaching and research.
cons: A large cohort of visiting faculty are hired every year, which results in a big turnover of faculty (which students don't like either).  This is both not permanent, but also pays less.

review_title: Great place to work as as Professor
job_title: Associate Professor in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros: Smart and motivated students, ample resources for teaching and research, great facilities, funding for research and conferences, good work-life balance, much better environmental than most liberal arts colleges which are in the middle of nowhere
cons: Saratoga Springs is not a big city, limited career options for spouses

job_title: Barista in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros:
-Beautiful campus
-Life-changing experiences
-Shift managers are absolutely the most amazing people
cons:
-Make less than minimum wage 
-No room for advancement/raise (there are no student supervisor positions, as there are at the other cafes)
-Customers are very entitled
-Upper-level management never orders the correct amount of product for the week
-No discounts on anything

review_title: A learning-based service job that improves with time
job_title: Academic Technologies Assistant in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros:
-flexible hours and great work/life balance
-fun projects
-opportunity to leave personal creation on work
-ability to make fast changes in small environment
cons:
-often not enough work to keep busy
-work gets done at a very slow rate

job_title: French Language Tutor in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros: Easy work and easy pay. As a language tutor in both the Writing Center and the language lab, I definitely feel like I get a chance to help people!
cons: The pay is somewhat low in the language lab ($8.25), and the lab is not highly publicized, so I can go a long time without tutoring anyone. We're getting new office space soon though, so that problem should improve!

review_title: Underpaid and Under-appreciated as a lifeguard at minimal wage.

pros: Its tax free because its a non profit. Its on campus so its convenient if you live on campus.
cons: You get paid minimal wage and it's a waste of time.

review_title: Flexible Hours, Ability to expand expertise

pros: Can tutor in a variety of subjects that you receive a specific grade in. Requires you to be proficient and intelligent in past courses you've taken, not just forget material.
cons: Cannot negotiate your salary as it is fixed for all tutors

job_title: Manager in Saratoga Springs, NY
pros: Prior to a shift in executive leadership, Skidmore was a great community.  The benefits are great but employees stayed  because it was such a great place to work. They used to prioritize family and that was worth it. Not anymore.
cons: Sadly, the community feel has dissolved and many employees have left  because they were either mistreated by leadership, or they no longer had work /life balance.
